date.description: A date or daterange in date or date-time format.

daterange.title: Date Range
daterange.description: A range of dates beginning with a start date and optionally ending in an end date.

description.description: A text description. Markdown is encouraged.
description.title: Description

documentType.title: Document Type
documentType.description: A description of the nature or genre of the data according to some controlled vocabulary.

id.description: A property reserved for globally unique identifiers. Examples of identifiers that are unique include UUIDs and DOIs.
id.title: Id

image.description: A path to an image used to represent this descriptor.
image.title: Image

keywords.description: A list of keywords that describe this descriptor.
keywords.title: Keywords

label.description: A label for this descriptor, often used for graphs.
label.title: Label

licenses.title: Licenses
licenses.description: The license(s) under which this resource is published.

name.title: Open Definition license identifier
name.description: MUST be an Open Definition license identifier, see http://licenses.opendefinition.org/

licenses.context: Use of this property does not imply that the person was the original creator of, or a contributor to, the data in the descriptor, but refers to the composition of the descriptor itself.

metapath.title: Metapath
metapath.description: An identifier string. Alphanumeric characters with `.`, `_`, `-` and `,` are allowed.
metapath.context: When followed by a resource `name`, the metapath should represent something like a filepath to the resource. Commas can be transformed to `/` in applications.

name.description: An identifier string. Lower case characters with `.`, `_`, and `-` are allowed.
name.title: Name

namespace.description: The version of the WE1S schema used to produce this manifest.
namespace.title: Namespace

notes.description: A list of notes that describe this resource.
notes.title: Notes

OCR.title: OCR
OCR.description: A boolean to indicate whether or not the data has been processed from an image into machine-readable text by Optical Character Recognition (OCR).

path.description: A fully qualified URL, or a POSIX file path.
path.title: Path

relationships.title: Relationships
relationships.description: A list relationships between the record and other records.

shortTitle.title: ShortTitle
shortTitle.description: A short or alternative title for the resource.

title.title: Title

version.title: Version
version.description: The version number of a record. Semantic versioning is encouraged. See https://semver.org/.
